keyPolicies.policyDescription: Focusing on brownfield sites, not on the inappropriate and expensive homes
At minimal expense by taking the railways back into public ownership as existing contracts end
Giving more support to frontline staff
Secure education free for all, keeping commercial interests out of the classroom
Becoming more ambitious about protecting our environment, investing more quickly and comprehensively in renewable technologies

issues.economy: Moratorium on out-of-town retail enclaves to help the local shops and economies
issues.education: Secure education free for all, keeping commercial interests out
issues.environment: Becoming more ambitious about protecting our environment, investing more quickly and comprehensively in renewable technologies
issues.governance: Taking the railways back into public ownership as existing contracts end
issues.health: Fully reinstating our NHS services and giving more support to frontline staff

housing.content: Ensuring affordable housing for all, focusing on brownfield sites, not on the inappropriate and expensive homes

leaflet.personalStatement: Born and bred in Woodbridge, a hands-on Greenpeace activist and eco-restorer, running marathons in a suffolk and elsewhere
